reviews.name: Pascal
reviews.text: le quartier est un de mes quartiers préféré de Paris. Quant à l'acueillette et à la gentillesse de Georges, il n'y a pas de mots.

reviews.name: Ayem
reviews.text: Très bien passé. très propre studio et bien située , transport, toute comédie . Le propriétaire très présent à toute demande. Petit déjeuner le matin avec des croissants de plus .Le lit très confortable et lapart très calme. Merci gorges.

reviews.name: Ludovine
reviews.text: Excellent accueil!! Appartement fonctionnel très bien desservi pour les transports Quartier agréable et restos sympas

reviews.name: Magali
reviews.text: Ludovine et Sébastien, vraiment désolé pour ce désagrément car c'est moi qui est fait le ménage et j'attache une attention particulière à ce point. Je redoublerez de vigilance

reviews.name: Marlène
reviews.text: Georges a été très accueillant, arrangeant avec de petites attentions très agréables (petit-déjeuner le 1er matin, sacs gardés chez lui le dernier jour...). Il nous a aussi bien renseignées sur les commerçants du quartier (qui sont très nombreux et sympathiques) et s'est montré disponible tout au long de notre séjour. L'appartement est idéal pour 2 adultes, propre, très calme (les grasses matinées possibles !!), fonctionnel et bien situé (proche des métros). Le quartier est sûr (même pour 2 filles...), on y trouve tous les commerces nécessaires à un bon séjour parisien. Nous recommandons vivement !

reviews.name: Pascal
reviews.text: Notre première expérience Airbnb a été une réussite. Georges à été très accueillant, son studio est très fonctionnel, idéalement situé et calme. Nous recommandons cette location.

reviews.name: Christian
reviews.text: Ce studio porte bien son nom, idéal pour flâner sur le canal et tout près du métro pour de plus lointaines balades. Très calme et bien placé, tout à côté des commerces, que demander de mieux. Notre hôte Georges est quant à lui d'une grande gentillesse, il nous a très bien reçu avec beaucoup de petites attentions qui contribuent à un séjour plus que réussi.

reviews.name: Olga
reviews.text: L'appartement est situé entre deux stations de metro: Chateau Landon (1 min) et Louis Blanc (3 min). Dans la rue Faubourg Saint Martin vous pouvez trouver tous les magasins nécessaires. Les fenêtres de l'appartement se donnent sur un cour calme et charment. En ce qui concerne l'appartement lui-même il est propre et très bien équipé. Je voudrais aussi mentionner que le lit est grand et vraiment confortable. Je voudrais remercier Georges pour l'accueil très chaleureux et je recommanderais cet appartement à mes amis!

reviews.name: Celine
reviews.text: Merci Olga, j'aurais plaisir à vous recevoir à nouveau

reviews.name: Audrey
reviews.text: J'ai passé quatre jours très agréables dans studio de Georges et Jean-Luc pour venir prospecter pour un logement à Paris. Fonctionnel (notamment avec le Murphy bed), très propre, et joliment arrangé, ce petit nid était parfait pour mon bébé et moi. Que dire de l'accueil de Georges, un homme absolument charmant, disponible, discret et toujours prêt à me faciliter la vie (en étant par exemple flexible sur les heures de départ et d'arrivée, en m'aidant à monter mes courses dans l'escalier ou encore en allant acheter une petite baignoire pour mon bébé à son initiative!) Le studio est à deux pas de la gare de l'Est et tous les commerces sont disponibles juste en bas. Allez-y les yeux fermés! For our English speaking friends: Georges will be your perfect French host (he is such a nice person), the studio your little Parisian nest (very clean and with everything you need) and the area, very central, will allow you to explore Paris easily while getting your fresh cheese, bread and meat right downstairs!

reviews.name: Priscila
reviews.text: J'ai passé un excellent séjour grâce à l'accueil chaleureux de Georges. Le studio était calme et confortable, avec beaucoup de gentilles attentions qui vous font sentir comme à la maison. J'aurai plaisir à y revenir. Merci pour tout!

reviews.name: Martin
reviews.text: Les jours que nous avons passés dans l'appartement de Georges étaient vraiment parfaits. Georges est généreux, poli, élégant et sympa. L'appartement est joli, parfaitement propre et bien organisé. Il y avait tout ce qu'il fallait. Georges nous a donné toute l'attention nécessaire. L'endroit est idéal, l'immeuble est très agréable et charmant. Nous lui serons toujours reconnaissants, car en plus d'avoir passé un agréable moment à Paris, avec Georges nous ont appris comment être un vrai hôte.

reviews.name: Maggy
reviews.text: Un accueil chaleureux, des proprios fort sympathiques, un appart propre, coquet et très bien situé. Quoi demander de mieux ? Nous recommandons cet appart à tous ceux qui veulent vivre une belle expérience à Paris ! Georges a répondu rapidement à toutes nos questions et avait le souci de faire en sorte que notre séjour soit des plus agréables . Mission accomplie ! Merci encore Georges et Jean-Luc ! Isabelle et Martin Québec, Canada

reviews.name: Nathalie
reviews.text: Belle appartement situé près de la gare du Nord et de l'est. Toute était à proximité. La gardienne nous a bien accueillie cars Georges n'était pas disponible. Il y avait une bouteille de vin pour nous a notre arrivée. Beau séjour. Fortement recommandé.

reviews.name: Véronique
reviews.text: Notre séjour dans l'appartement de Georges à été très agréable. L'accueil de la nièce de Georges à été parfait. Elle nous a expliqué le fonctionnement des appareils pour ensuite répondre à nos questions concernant le transport en commun. L'appartement et la salle de bain sont petits mais très bien décorés et propres. Parfait pour deux personnes. De plus, les attractions étaient facilement accessibles depuis l'appartement en prenant le métro dont la station était très près. Beau séjour !

reviews.name: Almari
reviews.text: Merci Georges pour votre chaleureux accueil. J'ai fort apprécié votre petit studio charmant, il est décoré avec goût et tous les petites attentions y sont présentes, thé mariage frères, café nespresso, jus de fruits... et la surprise du matin était délicieuse. Je recommande ce charmant logement. Le quartier est agréable, je me réjouis d'y retourner.

reviews.name: Kersani
reviews.text: Salut George notre séjour chez vous au 212 à été une très bonne expérience emplacement très bon proximité de tts metro cinémas comerce de proximité quartier tranquille est vivant George nous a laissé de bonne adresse on c regalais le studio est un petit peut petit mais super bien agencé voilà merci George et bonne continuation

reviews.name: Luc
reviews.text: Ce fut un agréable séjour et, notre première expérience sur airbnb en fut une excellente. Merci Georges pour votre accueil et vos bons conseils. Bien que petit (selon nos standards nord-américains!) tout était nickel! Nous n'avons manqué de rien. Le lit est confortable et l'appartement situé dans une cour intérieure est un oasis de paix. Location idéale si vous devez vous déplacer de ou vers CDG. Idéal pour un cour séjour.

reviews.name: Nadia
reviews.text: Nous avions une très bonne séjour chez Georges et Jean Luc. L'appartement était très convenient et ergonomique pour ses 18m2 et principalement très bien situé! Georges était présent pour tous que nous voulions. Alors...à bientôt!!

reviews.name: Lili
reviews.text: On a beaucoup aimé le studio, petit, mais tres bien équipé et propre, il ne manque rien, il y a meme un fer à repasser et un séchoir pour les cheveux, des ustensiles pour cuisiner, ... Il est très bien situé, près de la gare du Nord et de l'Est, ca nous a permis de nous deplacer rapidement et de visiter la ville. On trouve de tout pas loin, une épicerie vis à vis, boulangeries et marché de fruits et legumes, ... On recomande le studio à nos amis et à la famille et on va le louer lors d'une prochaine visite. Merci Georges, Liliana et Ovidiu

reviews.name: Lucie
reviews.text: Super notre séjour au 212 Faubourg St-Martin. Propre, tranquille, bien localisé, de belles attentions de l'hôte. Vivement recommandé, et profitez du Canal St-Martin piétonnier les dimanches!

reviews.name: Laurence
reviews.text: Super séjour dans le studio de Georges! Un très chouette quartier à découvrir... Le bonheur d'une balade près des quais (Valmy et Jemappes), l'animation d'un quartier avec des commerces de proximité (et très facile de rejoindre les différents quartiers de Paris)... et le havre de paix du petit studio qui donne sur une cour intérieure. Tout était parfait et un accueil adorable... thés, café, confitures et même les croissants le premeir matin ;-) Georges est une personne vraiment chouette qui a envie de partager ce qu'il aime dans son quartier! Le studio est en très bon état (bonne literie, bouilloire, nespresso...) et très propre. Vivement notre prochain séjour!

reviews.name: Sorina
reviews.text: Nous avons beaucoup apprécié notre séjour dans ce charmant logis. Le lit était confortable, la cour intérieure charmante et le voisinage pas du tout bruit. L'appartement est situe tout près de 2 grandes gares ainsi que de 2 stations de métro, très bien situé dans la ville. Georges été très accueillant et a rendu notre première expérience avec airbnb parfaite! On aurait pas pu espérer mieux je crois.

reviews.name: Valentine
reviews.text: Superbe séjour chez Georges et Jean-Luc. Nous avons été traités comme des princes et avons rencontré des personnes charmantes! Le studio est bien équipé et agréable à vivre. L'emplacement est très bien (proche gare de l'est, proche métro, proche commerces...) et le studio est calme. Le petit-déjeuner avec de supers croissants et pains au chocolat (+ confitures, café et thé) offert par nos hôtes était parfait. Un grand merci, nous ne manquerons pas de revenir et de recommander l'adresse. A bientôt. Valentine & Olivier

reviews.name: Kristen
reviews.text: J'ai resté quelques nuits ici, avec mon petit ami. Le studio est tellement charmant. Le boulangerie à cote de l'appartement est délicieux aussi. Georges est vraiment accueillant et la recommandation pour un resto (Chez Papa) etait génial. Merci !!

reviews.name: Tiphaine
reviews.text: Le studio est charmant comme le titre de l'annonce l'indique. J'avais besoin d'un nid douillet à l'abris du bruit des rues de paris et j'ai été comblée. Le studio est dans un immeuble qui donne sur une petite cour toute mignonne (décorée pour les fêtes par Mme Gomes, la charmante gardienne) et donc nous n'avons eu aucun problème avec le bruit de la ville . Nous n'avons croisés Georges que le jour de notre départ mais nous avons eu l'occasion de correspondre pour les préparatifs et il était, tout comme son studio, charmant =) Le studio était rempli de petites attentions (confitures, jus de fruits, etc...) dont nous avons vraiment pu profiter lors de notre séjour. Le quartier est sympa il y a énormément de petits commerce de proximité. Le studio est à deux pas de l'arrêt de métro Louis Blanc il a donc été très simple de naviguer. Même à pieds en passant par la gare de l'Est la ballade pour aller jusqu'au Halles est assez rapide (30-35 min). Merci pour tout Georges et Jean Luc, grâce à votre petit nid j'ai pu pleinement profiter de mon amoureux. Je reviendrai et j'espere qu'on aura l'occasion de se croiser plus longtemps =)

reviews.name: Lilian
reviews.text: Très joli studio, très bien équipé et dans un quartier agréable et vivant. Super séjour à Paris. Merci Georges!

reviews.name: Jean-Chretien
reviews.text: Un studio vraiment charmant et idealement place! Un hote remarquable avec lequel nous avons pu echanger peinture et decoration en sirotant un cafe. Que du bonheur!

reviews.name: Sabina
reviews.text: It's the spot if you're looking to live like a parisian! It's a beautiful small studio that has all you need! And on top of it the host is vey helpful! Thanks again Georges!

reviews.name: Luz
reviews.text: Georges was great he made me feel very welcome, with a breakfast of croissants the first morning a directions to the best restaurants and grocery stores. The neighborhood was really young and interesting with a brooklyn feel. Overall all I had and amazing experience.

reviews.name: Carole
reviews.text: Thanks Luz for this nice comment, you could comeback when you wish it Georges

reviews.name: Scott
reviews.text: Georges was a really nice host. Eventhough he was on vacation during our stay, he made sure that we know our way around in the building and told us about nice restaurants! Despite the fact that the studio is a bit small, its well furnished and you have everything you need in, from wifi, nice toilet and shower, ironing machine... Great for vacation Thank you Georges & Jean-Luc!!

reviews.name: Guillermo
reviews.text: Great place, very quaint! Host was very helpful, provided restaurant suggestions and tourist tips. Clean and fresh without fragrance over kill for any out there that has chemical allergies.

reviews.name: Veronica
reviews.text: The best place to stay in Paris. We're going to reserve this place again. Thanks for everything Georges!!

reviews.name: Raf
reviews.text: Georges's pace is near the metro and there are many eateries around the area (esp the bakery!). The place is very safe and Georges make the effort to get his neighbor to welcome us when he was away. His neighbor, Dominic, was really friendly and helpful as well. The room is small but it has everything that you need. The bed is really comfy too. Thank you Georges! :)

reviews.name: Ed
reviews.text: Definitely come back to this nicest place when I am back to Paris! Thank you Georges, always be at my disposal. Impeccable!

reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful stay with Georges. The flat was clean, modern and had all the ameneties of home including fridge, stove top, coffee maker and toaster. We had the most amazing fresh pasteries left for us our first morning. The bed was more than large enough for 2 and was firm and perfect. Soda and juice was waiting for us in the fridge. We had no less than 3 grocery stores within steps of the flat and a great bakery two doors to the left. Georges was very accommodating and ensured everything was perfect for our stay. Highly recommend this flat and Georges.

reviews.name: Sujata
reviews.text: A great host and very nice apartment in a very nice location.

reviews.name: Jackie
reviews.text: Great location, only 1 minute walk from Metro station. Nice quiet apartment and very comfortable bed! Having drinks waiting in the fridge and breakfast on our first day was really appreciated!

reviews.name: Patricia
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed there for 11 days. The studio was close to everything! We loved the st martin canal area it was fun to walk there in the early evening. Georges place is close to many grocery stores and yummy places to dine! We will stay there again!

reviews.name: Shanna
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay in Paris thanks to Georges. At check in he helped me map out my itinerary for my visit and explained a little about public transit. The pastries he left for me on the first morning were AMAZING! I ended up going to that bakery many times during my stay. The flat itself is cute, clean and it is pretty quiet at night. I will be back and will definitely stay again.

reviews.name: Areti
reviews.text: Totally recommend this place! Georges was an excellent host and the studio was beautiful, with all the amenities! We had a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.

reviews.name: Xiaojing
reviews.text: Landlord is very hospitable and help me a lot. The room location is very convenient have access to any scenery sports. The room is also tidy, although the space is a little small.

reviews.name: Maxi
reviews.text: Georges was such a nice person, the communication was perfect ( he also spoke a little bit german with is ), the studio was a small but beautiful apartment. I really recommend this studio!!

reviews.name: Liselot
reviews.text: This place is great, we really would like to stay here again. Georges is very friendly!

reviews.name: Gianina
reviews.text: Georges is a great host! We felt welcomed at all times and really appreciated the small details that made the experience even better, such as helping us with our luggage and leaving croissants in our door the first morning. The space is small but has everything you need for one/two people. We were comfortable during our whole stay. Location is pretty great, as it is close to transportation. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris!

reviews.name: Paulina
reviews.text: Very good

reviews.name: Ciaran
reviews.text: We cannot recommend Georges's apartment enough! You will read below about receiving pastries on the first morning, which was a wonderful gesture, but that was just the start of how brilliant a stay at Georges's apartment we had! The studio is gorgeous, nestled in a set of apartments with a couple of beautiful courtyards, with eateries just outside. There is not a single aspect of the studio overlooked, from city maps to a Nespresso machine, picnic materials and even a bottle opener on the keys! Gare de L'est and Château-Landon are two minutes away, whilst we were in the heart of Paris within a ten-minute walk! We will definitely be staying at Georges's when we next visit Paris, it was absolutely perfect and really allowed us to live like locals!

reviews.name: Jennifer
reviews.text: The studio was cute and located in a very nice area. Everything was absolutely perfect. No complains to make.

reviews.name: Felipe
reviews.text: George´s place is more than perfect for a short stay in Paris! The apartment has everything you could need from a super confortable bed to an expresso machine! not to mention it has all the basics. The apartment is quite well located in an area full of restaurants, supermarkets, cafes. also there is a metro station near by. George really makes you feel like home, he´s a extraordinary host. Overall just an amazing place!

reviews.name: Dimitris
reviews.text: Georges was a great host. Very helpful and kind. He welcomed us in a really friendly way with fresh french croissants and a bottle of Champagne in order to celebrate Christmas Eve. The apartment was really clean and the location was great just to minutes walk from the Metro station. We highly recommend it for anyone interested.

reviews.name: Rozanne
reviews.text: George's studio is perfect if you're planning a trip to Paris. It's very close to the metrostation, which will bring you everywhere in the city. George's place is very cosy and clean, anything you need after a long day of walking. He brought us delicious croissants the first morning, a perfect start of the day. It's a pleasure to meet George, we highly recommend this place!

reviews.name: Holly
reviews.text: Georges went above and beyond to make sure we checked in smoothly from our early flight. He gave us plenty of information which he tailored exactly to our needs for our stay in Paris. In a city which is not exactly known for being able to find a bargain, Georges' place provides amazing value for money and a great base for your trip to Paris. The crossiants and pan au chocolat he delivered for our first breakfast was a lovely touch. Merci Georges from your Scottish friends!

reviews.name: Junchao
reviews.text: Georges' apartment is super convenient for transportation and very clean. We enjoyed a great stay. He took care of us, for example introducing some good restaurants. The only pity thing is that the room is really small.

reviews.name: Lana
reviews.text: Hi Junchao, It is not only a room it is a studio with all the things inside for daily life ( table, chairs, kitchen etc ....) The size of the studio is mentioned on the AirB€B site, I think it I s a normal size for a bedroom in an traditional hotel in the center of Paris.

reviews.name: Sami
reviews.text: Georges was a great host. Our phones didn't work in Paris but he was outside the courtyard waiting for us when we arrived. Much easier then finding wifi to message him. He took us up to the apartment and gave us a tour of the place and how to use some of the stuff we were unfamiliar with. The apartment is cozy but very manageable for two people. It had a usable kitchen and appliances like a toaster, Nespresso, and kettle with burners, microwave and fridge. He had welcome drinks and jellies in the fridge for us which was a added and welcoming surprise. He also delivered us breakfast our first morning with fresh pastries from the bakery just outside the apartment. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed having fluffy pillows unlike the flat brick-like pillows we had at our hotel in London. The location couldn't have been better for us. Super close to two metro stations and the street the apartment is on had everything we needed; a bakery, cheese shop, grocery store, rotisserie stands, wine store and a beer store. We were very thankful for this as we were able to pick up food for dinner instead of eating out every night. I would highly recommend staying with Georges and will likely do so the next time we go to Paris.

reviews.name: Vivian
reviews.text: The apartment was exceptionally clean! Georges was a wonderful host and helped us with anything that we needed. He even provided us with breakfast on the first morning. Highly recommend staying at this apartment. Fast wifi, cosy home with everything that you need!

reviews.name: Jane
reviews.text: Georges was a great host and his apartment was small but it had everything you needed for your stay. It was in a very safe neighbourhood very close to two metro stations. It had a lot of good restaurants nearby and a wonderful bakery a few steps away. Georges was very helpful by providing us with information about the metro and choices of restaurants. He also left us some wonderful croissants for our first breakfast. Enjoyed our stay very much.

reviews.name: Jorge
reviews.text: Georges place has everything you need to have a good time in Paris. Very good located with metro station, brasseries, markets and restaurants in the same street. Studio is clean and Georges ensured that we've had everything we need. He is also a lovely person with great tips about the city. I'm 100% sure that I will stay again at Georges place when coming back to Paris!

reviews.name: Ryan Craig
reviews.text: What a great little studio! Georges was super friendly and helpful. The place is super close to two train stations and metro stations with shops and cafes all around filled with locals. It was nice to get away from tourists when we came back each night. We will definitely come back to stay again; it was simple and everything we needed.

reviews.name: Ryan
reviews.text: The location is great. Apartment looks out onto a very cute courtyard. It is a 3 flight stair climb to get to the apartment. Very small but cute. Georges had coffee & juice available. And he brought croissants for our first breakfast.

reviews.name: Adom
reviews.text: The nicest host! Such a cute and nice place very convenient to get to all the touristy places! So enjoyable !

reviews.name: Lidia
reviews.text: This apartment is in a great location, close to transport (bus, metro and rail) with cafes, restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets and laundries all within walking distance. Also great having a kitchen and coffee/tea prep area. Georges was very helpful, always available for any questions and friendly.

reviews.name: Edward
reviews.text: Georges was very welcoming and helpful. The studio was ideal and well located and equipped. complementary coffee, snacks etc were provided. We had to do nothing to feel at home thanks to Georges. Will definitely return!

reviews.name: Fábio
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at Georges place. The flat is small but has everything: an expresso machine, a toaster, A.C., excelent Wifi connection... There are two metro stations near the house and lots of restaurants and grocery shops nearby. Georges is the perfect host, gave us lots of great tips, offered us a nice wine, croissants and jam on the first day, and made us feel welcome. Truly recommend Georges place to anyone!

reviews.name: Amanda
reviews.text: Our stay here was absolutely perfect. Georges is an excellent host and was always quick to respond to our questions through email. During our stay he emailed us to make sure we had everything we needed. We got to the apartment much earlier than we had planned and Georges let us drop off our luggage. The next morning we found that Georges had left us breakfast from the bakery next door outside out door. His kind gestures made us feel so welcome! His place is exactly like the picture and very comfortable for two people. It is very clean in the studio and the courtyard is very nice as well. The location is perfect; we were able to walk everywhere and there are two metro stations very close by. The street is fairly quiet and felt very safe, even when out late at night. We are still talking about how lucky we got to find such a great place to stay for our trip. The price, location, and the wonderful host all made our trip wonderful. We have said again and again that we would definitely stay here again for our next trip to Paris.

reviews.name: Tahlia
reviews.text: Georges was a great host. The accommodation is exactly like the photos and served every need we had. It was a good location to get everywhere around Paris.

reviews.name: Jose
reviews.text: Location is perfect, close to train station, bus station and alot of shops to eat and shop. Apartment was nice and very cozy.

reviews.name: Roy
reviews.text: I agree with all the wonderful reviews written before me regarding the apartment, cleanliness, location and so on. I would like to note especially the owner Georges - gracious, generous, welcoming and very supportive. We had an emergency situation in Paris and he spent his free time to help us, accompany us and calm us. Absolutely gorgeous!

reviews.name: Zaneta
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay, very convenient to access from Gare du Nord and close to several metro stations. The studio is compact but well equipped with everything you need and Georges was incredibly helpful with reccomendations of where to eat on the area, helping us plan metro travel and even providing pastries for our first breakfast. All in all an ideal place to stay in Paris - I would definitely reccomended it.

reviews.name: Bridgett
reviews.text: Georges was very nice and welcoming and left many helpful pieces of information to help us get to know Paris. The space was secure and cute, I can think of no negatives about our stay.

reviews.name: Kate
reviews.text: Georges was very welcoming and kind. He left us wine to enjoy and brought us croissants on the first morning

reviews.name: Analli
reviews.text: My experience in Georges studio exceeded any expectation, which were already high due to the reviews. Georges made me feel like I had I friend in Paris, helped in all details. The photos are totally true about the studio, it is ideal, we had coffee, tea, welcoming drinks, delicious croissaint in the morning. Everything was great, I would definetly stay at Georges again, I would even chose his studio over many hotels I have already been to.

reviews.name: Cindy
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at Georges Airbnb. The apartment/room lived up to all our expectations and was perfectly located between 2 metro stations. There is a good selection of cheese shops, bakeries and restaurants in the area. Georges is also extremely accommodating and hospitable host. He was very helpful and even sent us a message to inform us in the morning that The Louvre was closed due to flooding in Paris. And he went the extra mile to give us recommendations on which other museums we could visit. The amenities he provided for us in the fridge was also very thoughtful and unexpected. We highly recommend Georges and his Airbnb!

reviews.name: Jenn
reviews.text: Georges was a fantastic host and this little studio was ideal for my husband and I as we were visiting Paris. Georges was very accommodating and even provided us with some croissants for breakfast our first day. The studio is small but perfectly sufficient. It is also close to plenty of public transport which made it easy to get around the city. We arrived early in the morning while another couple was still in the studio, but Georges let us drop off our baggage and even gave us some recommendations of what to do while we were waiting. Great, comfortable place with a very helpful host. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

reviews.name: Priya
reviews.text: I am so happy with my first AirBnB experience as well as my first time visiting Paris. Georges' cosy studio apartment was in a great location in the 10th district of Paris. It was quiet so we had a great sleep each night we stayed. It was in walking distance of Place de la Republique and only minutes away from 2 train stations and metro stops. We were surrounded by a variety of restaurants from all different cultures so we we're never stuck for how to get around or where to eat. George himself was a very kind host, helping us with our baggage and leaving us with welcome drinks on the first day and croissant breakfast in the morning so we were able to have a comfortable stay. He also explained where the best places to eat were and the best way to get around. It was a little rainy on our first day in Paris, so when arriving back at the apartment we put the heating on and it warmed up very quickly. The apartment has everything you need for long or short breaks with a range of supermarkets, clothes shops, restaurants surrounding so you will never feel you are without anything you need. My friend and I felt we were well looked after for our whole stay. Thank you Georges for allowing myself and Karan to stay in your apartment for our short break to Paris. We are very pleased with the location and our first Airbnb experience. I will be visiting soon again and would be happy to stay here again if available.

reviews.name: Abhishek
reviews.text: Georges is a very nice host. This was my first AirBnB booking and I loved the georges place. The neighbour hood is safe you can take a walk in the night and very close to metro station.

reviews.name: Nidarat
reviews.text: Georges is a very good host. His room is not large but very cute. He contacted me before the date to ask when I will land and gave me direction to his apartment. His apartment is next to this one. He met us on the first day and helped us carried our bags, showed us the room and have welcome drink ready! The room is clean and close to subway. On the first day he gave us a breakfast and recommend us a cheese shop and a wine shop. I recommend Georges’s place for you!

reviews.name: Виктория
reviews.text: George is really wonderful. Before the trip been reading reviews and all true. The apartment is cozy and clean and has everything you need - Hairdryer, iron, TV, fridge, kitchen utensils, even two umbrellas! For budget travellers there is a kitchen where you can cook dinner. The owner provides bed linen and towels of good quality. Convenient balshoy bed. Wi Fi good speed. Near the apartment many nice shops and cafes (store cheese, meat, vegetables and fruit, wine). Subway line 7 1 minute from the apartment. Near two train stations North and East, which is very convenient. George is always ready to help if you need anything! On the first day, guests receive a Breakfast of French croissants (unforgettable) and a bottle of wine. For me when renting an apartment is very important to the security of the area. And it's really quiet and safe area! We spent a magical week in Paris visiting George! Stay in Paris in this French house for little money! Definitely recommend!!! Thank you George, hope to see you again in the future!

reviews.name: Wojciech
reviews.text: Very nice studio, great host and location! Coffee maschine and a croissant from the host in the morning made me feel even more welcome! Highly recommended!!!

reviews.name: Josefine
reviews.text: The stay at George's place was everything we had hoped for. Good location near the canal st. Martin - an absolutely must visit in Paris. The studio was well equipped, good facilities and a comfortable bed. Finally George was a good host. He welcomed us even though we arrived a little late and the were fresh croissants for the first morning. A perfect place to stay in Paris.

reviews.name: Alexandra
reviews.text: Georges was absolutely wonderful host! Very friendly and helpful! The apartment is so cute and cozy, everything you need is there plus WIFI is very fast if you need it :) Neighborhood is very nice, close to the metro lines, also shops in the street are great( cheese, bakery, fruit,seafood) and big selection of wine bars and restaurants . We would definitely come back! Thank you Georges on everything!

reviews.name: Carla
reviews.text: George is really nice, he welcome US with croissants and pan au chocolate, the studium has everything you need and is very well located, close to the metro station. In the neighbor you have everything you need, a place to drink a glass of wine at the end of the day or the "boulangerie" to buy croissants at morning. At Saint Martin studium you fell at home

reviews.name: Barbara
reviews.text: We weren't able to meet Georges in person but met his lovely friends Jean Luc and Helen who gave us a very warm welcome on arrival. The studio was really small & cosy but after a while you get used to it and actually starts to feel quite spacious - perfect for couples. It was also close to everything, about a 2 minute walk to the supermarket, a minute away from the metro and next door to a very nice bakery which made our trip a lot more enjoyable. Jean luc also treated us to some croissants on our first morning. I think what makes this studio is where it's located as it's quite close to a lot of the tourists attractions in Paris as well as cafe's and restaurants down the street. Thanks Georges

reviews.name: Desmond
reviews.text: Due to the plane delayed we arrived later than we expected and we contacted George about the delayed, although George was not in the house to show us around he has his friend doing the job perfectly with a really warm welcoming. The flat has all the essentials that you need and compliments (Coffee, Jams, Drinks, a bottle of wine etc) and first day breakfast is provided which is really nice. We went to most of the recommendation restaurant from George and is wonderfully tasty. On the last day George kindly showed us the way to the Gare du nord station which we are so glad as we were thinking of taking the taxi. Overall the place is wonderful and definitely recommending the place to any couple is on holiday.

reviews.name: Ilian
reviews.text: The studio was comfortable, although a bit small I felt very much at home! George is really a good host and very , very helpful to his guests! I would stay there again!

reviews.name: Susan
reviews.text: Georges came to look for me when I wasn't sure how to find the apartment. He took time to tell me about places to visit and eat. He was very friendly and helpful, and I saw him a couple times during my stay.

reviews.name: John
reviews.text: Georges is a very hospitable and gracious host. Though the room is small it is very well appointed and manageable. We had a great time. Recommended.

reviews.name: Frank
reviews.text: Georges was amazing!!! He's very helpfull and a excelent host! The apartment is Well organized and very charmed! Is very near to the metro station and easy to arrived by AirPort. Thank's for All Georges! Ser you soon in Brasil!!!

reviews.name: Terry
reviews.text: We found Georges to be very helpful and charming. The apartment was cozy, well organized and very quiet. We enjoyed the convenience to local shops and the subway. Georges did his best to make our stay enjoyable. We would recommend this apartment to other travelers.

reviews.name: Becky
reviews.text: What a great host! The little loft was perfect. The bed was comfortable. We enjoyed the tea and loved getting the croissants on the first morning we were there. It is close to the metro and a very yummy bakery is very close. He was very kind and very helpful. Gave us a great suggestion on a place to eat dinner. Would definitely recommend this place!

reviews.name: Renato
reviews.text: I had an amazing experience at George's flat. The neighbour is fantastic, you will find anything you need really close, gare du nord is 5 min walking, 1min from supermarkets, lan houses, piccard, brasseries. As well as the location, the apartment is perfect for 2 people and georges is an awesome guy, helps in whatever you need and is quite simpatetic. I can not leave to comment that his friend Dominique is also an awesome guy. I highly recommend Georges flat

reviews.name: Weihui
reviews.text: Nice, cozy apartment that's easy to locate and convenient. We dint get to meet Georges. However, he left some drinks and jam for us which we tot it's very thoughtful of him. Georges' friend, Dominic helped us with our check in and out. Dominic is very helpful and friendly. Would recommend the apartment to others!

reviews.name: Tanika
reviews.text: Our stay in Paris was amazing. The apartment had everything we could of needed and Georges was a great host. We would definitely stay again.

reviews.name: Jason
reviews.text: Georges was extremely hospitable, very well organized & communicated well (French or English) in advance of the booking. Apartment was clean and in nice condition, as in the pictures. He added several nice touches: bottle of Champagne, juice, fresh flowers and breakfast on our first morning. Georges was easily accessible and available, if needed. Nespresso machine was also fully utilized by my wife and I. Very close to the Metro station and in the heart of Canal St. Martin. Several nice shops & restaurants nearby. Small, by American standards, but perfect for a single person or couple looking to explore the City of Lights.

reviews.name: Wil
reviews.text: Hi Jason Why you donot ask for annoter bath towels? I dont hab Vie enough time before your arrival to relate the fixation of the shower head Sorry for that

reviews.name: Doug
reviews.text: Georges' BnB is located near both the Gare De L'Est and Gare du Nord train stations, making it convenient for travelers going to other parts of France or to other European countries. The space is small compared to American standards but therein lies it's beauty; it is very Parisian--chic and intimate but still effortlessly comfortable in its own skin. Georges is like his BnB, a colorful character. Charming yet wity. Honest but warm. He gave us the rundown on the apartment and let us loose to discover the city. Georges' and his place will definitely be part of our fond memories of Paris.

reviews.name: Peter
reviews.text: We found this small, conveniently located apartment to be charming as described. It is smaller than we imagined from the picture but efficiently designed and arranged to make it very workable. Although the host was unable to be there when we arrived he had arranged to have us greeted and shown around. That worked out very well. The location was very close to the train and metro so it made all the tourist attractions are well within reach. The apartment arranged inside a quiet courtyard with groceries and restaurants close by.

reviews.name: Rita
reviews.text: Our stay at Georges' studio was fantastic! It was the perfect getaway for our honeymoon. Georges was very gracious and made sure we were comfortable during our eight-day stay. He provided us with a bottle of honeymoon champagne, crackers, some jams, and some pain au chocolate and croissants to welcome us. The studio is small but very efficient and well-appointed with absolutely everything we needed during our stay - dishes, microwave, coffee maker, tea pot, ironing board, even a laundry basin and detergent. It was clean and cozy, and the Murphy bed was surprisingly comfortable. We wanted a place that was away from the really touristy areas, and wanted to "live like locals," and this area was exactly that. The flat is situated close to Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est, and also convenient to several Metro stations, so it's easy to get around the city, if you're comfortable with using public transit. The usual sites like the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame are only about 20 minutes away, and the Metro only costs 14,10€ for a 10-pack of tickets. The neighborhood is full of patisseries, boulangeries, fromageries, and small markets where you can pick up provisions for meals in the flat, or for picnics on the Canal Saint-Martin. It was more of a real Parisian experience than staying in a hotel in the tourist district. We loved every minute and would stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

reviews.name: Kathleen
reviews.text: My stay at the Saint Martin apartment was wonderful. The area is very vibrant and there are lots of bakeries, cafes and shops near by. The flat is in a great location a few minutes from the Chateau Landon metro station, but comfortable walking distance to Gare de Nord and Gare de l'Est. I was travelling alone and I felt very safe in the area and in the flat as the apartment was set back from the street off a quiet garden courtyard. The photos are an accurate representation of the flat, and I found it clean, tastefully decorated and quiet. Georges was fabulous - he was very prompt on communication and the apartment was well stocked with coffee and tea as well as cold beverages and basic cooking staples. I was particularly grateful for the delivery of croissant on the first morning of my stay. I would definitely recommend the flat and hope to return again.

reviews.name: Bjørn Harald
reviews.text: Georges was a very attentive and pleasant host. There was some jams and other refreshments in the fridge as well as Coffee/Tea for us to enjoy during the stay. He even delivered Croissants outside the door the first morning. Also he was very helpful taking care of our luggage after checkout the last day (as we had an evening-flight home). He even made an arrangement with a close by shop for us to pick up the luggage as he was out when we should pick up the luggage. The place is very calm and do have window into the lovely backyard and not towards the street. The apartment is very small, but still very cleverly furnished and decorated, so you have just the things you need where it is needed. For big persons I think you may find the bathroom a bit small. Will definitely stay at this nice little studio-apartment again in a future trip to Paris.

reviews.name: Willson
reviews.text: Very good experience, clean apartment that is near transit and good restaurants, pharmacy, and a supermarket. Good value for your money, georges was excellent, very helpful and friendly. It was hard for us to find because we were so unfamiliar with the streets of Paris, so bring (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) maps with you! It is a block away from Metro Chateau Landon. Overall, we had a good experience and would stay again!

reviews.name: Mithun
reviews.text: Recently me with my wife and little kid visited Paris. The stay at Geroges studio was perfect. Though we reached at an odd hour (23:00 hrs), we were greeted with nice welcome gestures. The studio was same as described in the website. The location was advantageous and safe. One can access Chateau Landon Metro station within a minute. In fact, we use to walk from Gare de l'est almost everyday, which is a hub of several metro lines. The street is very happening location, full of restaurants bakeries and many more shops. One can feel the buzz of life even during late evening hours. We were given the studio in an extremely neat and clean condition. It has all facilities even for cooking an eating. Georges is a very nice host. He replied promptly all of my queries almost immediately and provided me a nice guideline to reach his place. He personally looks after the comfort of his guest. He left for us some welcome drinks in the fridge and treated us with nice croissant breads in the next morning. Geroges took care to provide a small bed in addition for my little baby. In total, would rate the stay excellent and probably one cannot think of a better combination of all necessary comforts with advantage of location. I have already recommended the apartment to several of my friends and colleagues, who are planning to visit Paris. Thanks Georges for making our stay so comfortable.

reviews.name: Stephanie
reviews.text: I recently stayed here with my mom and we absolutely loved this charming, cozy studio. It was perfect for the 2 of us. The pictures and location are very accurate. The metro is like a minute walk and very close to Gard Du Nord. After a long day of sightseeing we looked forward to coming back to this place. In fact, we are at another airbnb place in Italy and we keep wishing this place was more like Georges' and miss it very much. Georges is also a very kind and generous host. He provided delicious croissants our 1st morning and left drinks in our fridge. He was also very accommodating to our needs. Couldn't have asked for better experience!! If I come back I would book this place in a heartbeat. Thank you Georges!

reviews.name: Christopher
reviews.text: What a great little place! The space is pretty cozy, but the location was great. Just a short walk to Gare De l'Est and Gare Du Nord, two of the main transit hubs for the city. The small kitchenette made it so we didn't have to spend a fortune on restaurant food during our time in Paris. We did have a little mix-up when we arrived, because even though the title of the listing is "Saint Martin 212", the apartment is on 212 Rue du Fauborg Saint Martin. The correct address is in the listing, so that's on us, but just be aware. Overall, it was a great home base for our short time in Paris, and the wonderful boulangerie and fromagerie just down the street made for some delicious breakfasts before our sightseeing excursions. Thanks, Georges! We'll be back!

reviews.name: Nicky
reviews.text: This was our 2nd Air BnB stay in an apartment to ourselves and we were delighted once again with the effortless pleasure we gained from a more authentic stay in another European city. Georges wasn't there to greet us on arrival but he organised for his neighbour Helene to meet us at the apartment. She was charming and ran through everything we needed to know. Georges communication from the first enquiry to the end of our stay was impeccable. The studio was small but perfectly formed. I wanted to stay somewhere close to Canal St Martin and this was an ideal location as it was also walking distance from our arrival station of Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est was a stones throw with great Metro connections there. The Studio was clean and well maintained with lovely bed linen and the supplies of coffee, loose leaf tea and cold beverages, not to mention the delivery of croissants on our first morning were lovely and thoughtful touches. The boulangerie just a couple of doors down is superb! We stayed a total of four nights and were thrilled to come home to the studio each night after a days adventuring. The studio is set in a private courtyard so is peaceful and secure too. Georges lives below so was on hand had we had any problems. When we got to meet him, he was so kind and apologised about the weather but we really had a marvellous time. He was also very gracious after my accident washing up on our last morning when I broke a plate. I felt awful but he was kind about that too. Would absolutely recommend to anyone wanting a peaceful place to stay with a host that cares and wishes to offer an authentic stay with great tips on where to shop and eat. The location is brilliant for anyone at all and especially those travelling by Eurostar to Gare du Nord

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.text: Thanks Nicky for this kind comments As sometimes I am guest with AirB&B or others, I do my best to avoid to my guests the problems I had, but first of all I like to meet people and exchange with them

reviews.name: Paul
reviews.text: Georges was a wonderful host. My girlfriend and I received a friendly greeting upon arrival and were told about the local area, while breakfast in the morning was a really nice touch. The apartment itself was tiny yet never uncomfortable – it was clean, quiet, had everything we needed for the weekend, and quickly became a comfortable place to return home to after a day out. The location is also superb, being very close to the metro and Gare du Nord and within walking distance of some fine restaurants and bakeries. Thank you Georges for making our visit to Paris such a pleasant one – we hope to return some day.

reviews.name: Brandi
reviews.text: My stay at Georges' flat was parfait! I had never visited Paris before and his place was everything as described, easy to access and all I needed. Georges also pointed out places to visit and some first-timer advice for getting around Paris (not to mention, some fresh crossiants for the first full morning in Paris). I will definitely be staying again upon my return to Paris. Merci beaucoup, Georges!

reviews.name: Vlada
reviews.text: We had a great time in Paris. Georges was a wonderful host. He took the time to introduce us to the neighborhood and he was always available. The apartment is perfectly located and very quiet. Great experience!

reviews.name: Herman
reviews.text: My friend and I had a great time in Paris staying in Georges' apartment. It is very cosy and clean, includes everything you need, and we especially enjoyed coffee every morning. We also found the location very convenient to get to various destinations. Bunch of restaurants and coffee shops around is also an advantage! Thank you once again to Georges! :)

reviews.name: Leen
reviews.text: Amazing stay. Georges was the perfect host - great on communication, direction, recommendations. He even brought croissants over on the first morning. Location was also great, very convenient. Lots of great restaurants and bakeries on the same street. Thank you once again!

reviews.name: Pierre
reviews.text: Georges has been an excellent host. The studio is pretty and very well located, near the Canal Saint Martin and close to both Paris-North and Paris-East stations (very useful when coming by Thalys or CDG airport). The welcome pack (a good bottle of wine and some good sweeties the morning after) has been really appreciated. I really recommend coming to this place for a short or mid-term stay, alone or by two. Thanks, Georges, for your efficiency and your kind support during the whole stay. I am looking forward to coming back again and enjoying this very good accomodation.

reviews.name: Sarah
reviews.text: Georges and his studio are absolutely wonderful. I can't recommend them highly enough. When we arrived in Paris, Georges greeted us, gave us the keys, and gave us recommendations on places to see and eat nearby. The apartment is very cozy, comes equipped with a Nespresso machine, tea kettle, hairdryer and iron, and boasts a great location. I'd stay again in a heartbeat. Thanks so much, Georges!

reviews.name: S
reviews.text: Georges, our host, was extremely welcoming....warm, friendly, very thoughtful. He gave us interesting tips about the neighborhood, and Paris, provided fabulous amenities, and brought a lovely treat to eat for breakfast our first morning.

reviews.name: Anny
reviews.text: the apartment is situated on the main street, unlike the map given, it took us a bit longer to find the place. the concierge gave us a warm wellcome and shown us everything and give us a big smile every morning. the room is petite as its described, but i think its a perfect size for two. fully equipped with great tea/coffee and clear instruction/recommendation. it couldn't be better. the community courtyard is quiet and safe. we really enjoyed our stay. will definitely return next year.

reviews.name: Connie
reviews.text: The apartment and location were perfect, and Georges is a wonderful host! Highly recommend spending an afternoon on the Canal St. Martin and going with Georges restaurant recommendations - he won't steer you wrong!

reviews.name: Joseph
reviews.text: We had a really good time at the apartment. Georges wasn't available to welcome us but kept us updated with how to arrive in his absence, which meant it went very smoothly. It was unexpected that we had wine and drinks left for us and croissants and pains aux chocolat on our first morning. His recommendations for the area and beyond were much appreciated and we loved Canal St Martin. Thank you Georges for a wonderful stay.

reviews.name: Susan
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Paris and our first experience with airbnb. Everything was just Perfect! Georges is a wonderful host and was there to meet us when we arrived. The apartment was exactly as described and so clean. Georges had stocked the refrigerator with beverages and even left us croissants for our first breakfast in Paris. He was happy to provide recommendations on places to eat and things we might want to do or see while there. The apartment has everything you could possibly need including a hairdryer, outlet adapters, air conditioning, and an iron. We loved the Canal St. Martin neighborhood because it was not "touristy," yet minutes away from everything you would want to see. There was a metro station on the corner and you are within walking distance of Gare du Nord. There is also a Velib bike station on the corner, which was fabulous. All in all it was a perfect vacation and we are looking forward to a return trip.

reviews.name: Pamela
reviews.text: Georges was super. He was helpful and pleasant. Although he wasn't there personally when we arrived he had made arrangements for another person to let us in. The studio is compact but has everything you need. You can cook if you wish, the bed was comfortable, the coffee maker made good coffee anad it was very clean.The air conditioner was very welcomed when it turned hot.

reviews.name: Ruben
reviews.text: Thanks Pamela our meeting was for me very pleasant even you had some little technical problems with the window and the keys. I really hope seeing you again for another stay in Paris or near Carcassonne.

reviews.name: Andrey
reviews.text: The apartment was lovely as well as the location. Was able to get around Paris easily with two metro stops nearby. Georges was very accommodating, offered tips on getting around different parts of Paris and answered any questions I had. The apartment overall was great, a quiet living space. Unfortunately, there was one day that I had a real problem with. There was work scheduled to be done in the apartment that I was unaware of. On this day in particular, I had really bad back pains and did not leave the apartment until later in the afternoon. Georges came up to the room with the service man and said that he needed to get in and I felt like I had no option but to let them in. I was lying in bed for about two hours in pain while the service man did his work. I was completely exposed, this is a small studio so it’s not like I could go into another room and we didn’t have to see each other. I feel as if I wasn’t there, the service man would have been let in anyway. This made me very uncomfortable as all my travel documents, tablet, and other valuables/personal items were kept in the room. Even if I wasn’t going through back pains, I wouldn’t have felt comfortable having a complete stranger in the room while I wasn’t there. For this, I cannot leave a rating higher than two stars – it’s completely unacceptable by any means to have myself and my personal property exposed when the rental was for the entire place. I expected privacy the entire time.

reviews.name: Claire
reviews.text: It was the first time I have to do this: going into the studio while some guest is. But I don't have other choice, I don't choose the date and the hour for the intervention of the technical man from the wifi company operator to improve the wifi connexion As it was an emergency intervention from the company. It was near midday, the man was never alone in the studio, we took care to disturb as less is possible Ruben, we never touch his personal things. Trying to compensate this I offer for the second time croissants to Ruben for his following breakfast. Meanwhile I saw that Ruben had neck problem and I gave him some medicament to cure that without going in the studio I could not know this. Ruben I think you are a little bit excessive in your comments and conclusion, sometimes in the life in emergency situation you have only one choice, may be you are too young to know that or may be you don't travel enough to give the good price to each problem. If one day you come back I will do my best to avoid this situation come again, but whose know :-)

reviews.name: Christina
reviews.text: Excellent location. Property small ,but it Paris! You don't need more. The place was clean and comfortable. Host was not only welcoming us with bottle of wine and croissant in the first morning but also shared tips on best places to visit and where to eat. We were so glad we chose to stay at Georges place and would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris. By all means, it was a fantastic week to stay!

reviews.name: Luke
reviews.text: I stayed in George's apartment with my husband, for a week. It was the first time to be in Paris for myself and husband and also to experience Airbnb, so I was bit worried before I arrived. However, his apartment was the perfect, great, cozy and convenient. George was a great host as he provided useful information and delicious croissant and also much of kindness. The apartment is exactly same as in the picture and have all you need to stay and enjoy Paris. My stay in Paris was perfect due to his apartment and I really appreciate it!!!! I strongly recommend his apartment to everyone who wants to travel to Paris.

reviews.name: Lillian
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at Georges' apartment in June 2014 and we had a wonderful stay. Georges was a wonderful host! He was very friendly, helpful, and welcoming! He gave us recommendations of nearby restaurants and shops (you must go to the bakery next door...we went there every day!) One morning, he brought us delicious croissants! His apartment is small but has everything you need: wifi, stove, fridge, utensils, nespresso machine, teapot, bathroom, hot water, etc. The apartment itself is a 5 minute walk from a metro stop and about 10 minutes from Gare de l'est. The building courtyard is adorable and quiet! Overall, I highly recommend Georges' apartment to other travelers!

reviews.name: Mabel
reviews.text: Georges was very accommodating and went out of his way to make sure we were able to get into the apartment when our train to Paris was delayed and we had to show up later than our original check in. There are indeed croissants that he leaves at your door the morning after you get there, which were delicious. The apartment is small, cozy and as pictured. I wish that I weren't trying to cut back on caffeine, because there is a Nespresso machine with pods for guests to use. However, I did enjoy the electric kettle and tea that was available. The apartment is close to a Metro station that we used to get into the heart of Paris, which was a plus for my boyfriend and I. All in all, we enjoyed the stay. Merci beau coup!

reviews.name: Martin
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Georges place last week for a 5 day trip to Paris. Our apt was small but very clean and Parisian and we were both made to feel extremely welcome by Georges who met us and also told us a couple of really good nearby bistros (which was very useful as we arrived in Paris on one of their bank holidays). The location of the apt was excellent in terms of being a 5mins walk to the nearest Metro station and a 10mins walk from Gare de Nord. The Canal St Martin area is really lovely, esp along the canal where we went on our first day. There are some really good cafes and restaurants along there. For anyone who wants to visit Paris, we would definitely recommend using Georges apt as your base. We were especially pleased on our first morning when he kindly provided us with fresh croissants and pain au chocolats for our breakfast! We would definitely stay at his place again.

reviews.name: Travis
reviews.text: Perfectly sized studio in an adorable building with everything one needs for a stay in Paris. Close to transportation, trains and metro, and not a terrible walk from the main sights of Paris if you don't mind walking. Georges is very friendly and helpful, will answer any questions you have! Highly recommend this for a stay in Paris.

reviews.name: Dan
reviews.text: Georges was an excellent host, leaving us fresh croissants on the first morning and providing nice touches in the apartment such as a bottle of wine, an espresso machine and cold drinks in the fridge. Lovely little apartment for couples looking for somewhere to rest after a long day of taking in Paris. I would definitely recommend and stay again. The only downside being that there wasn’t quite enough hot water for my girlfriend and I to both take showers and for her to wash her hair.

reviews.name: Fabrizio
reviews.text: Dan, to have more hot water you have to increase the temperature of the eating boiler and mixing the very hot water with the cold one you will have enough water for you and for your girl friend. You are the first one saying that even the other girls friends with long hair did not have this kind of problem Sorry, sorry Dan

reviews.name: Aretha
reviews.text: This apartment is small, but it is lovely and very well furnished, with everything in the right place! Its location allows guests to easily explore every single part of Paris: in fact, George's flat is about 30 mt from Chateau Landon metro station and 50 mt from Louis Blanc stop (both line 7 of Metro Paris) and nearby Gare du Nord station from which you can take RER B to arrive/depart towards both Paris airports (CDG and Orly). The district is very quiet and is a nice area full of shops and restaurant, not far from Canal St.Martin. George is the perfect host! He welcomed us in a very friendly way, he is a very kind person and in the first morning he offered us breakfast (croissant and other yummy things taken from the lovely patisserie/boulangerie under the flat), although he said to me that was only croissant and not a full breakfast, I answered him that was a perfect breakfast because our arrival he has provided to set up some juices and soda in the fridge, and some capsule of coffee for Nespresso machine! So, if you want to visit Paris, you have to stay in George's flat...we highly recommend it!

reviews.name: Hunter
reviews.text: Booked the apartment after reading all the reviews and thanks for them! This was my 1st airbnb experience & it was great! Throughly enjoyed the stay at Georges, he was very helpful & communicative via email pre-arrival. The studio is as how it looks in the photos, small but very cosy & well-planned. All the appliances are in place & spotless & Georges did a great job in keeping the apartment in very good condition. The bed is very comfortable & clean. The toilet / bathroom is small but very well-designed and I love the heated towel rail. The stairs are a little narrow, so be careful when travelling with big luggages. We did have some issues with the wifi but friendly neighbours Mdm Gomes & Helen came to our rescue & soon after Georges solved the problem after an airbnb message although he was far away in Mexico. The apartment is 2min from an M7 metro station (direct line to many sights), & amazing that it is on a lovely quiet street that is so near to Gard d'Lest & such close distance to Gard Du Nord. It is so convenient. There are many supermarkets along the way from the stations & 1 directly opposite the apartment. The bakery right next door sells really good pastries; love them. Would recommend and stay if I visit Paris again. Thanks Georges, Mdm Gomes & Helen!

reviews.name: Fabio
reviews.text: The studio is small but clean and cozy. It is very close to the Metro station and 10 minutes walk from Gare du Nord. The area is nice and the restaurants recommended by Georges are very good and affordable. Georges and Jean Luc have been very kind, the communication was great and the fresh croissants on our first morning a delight. We definitely recommend this place to an active couple who wants a convenient base to explore Paris.

reviews.name: Louise
reviews.text: This is our second time staying with Georges and it was perfect! Great location and a clean and well equipped apartment! A must stay when in Paris!

reviews.name: Shane
reviews.text: Georges was a terrific host: friendly, calm and considerate. (I very much appreciated the pastries left on my first morning.) And the apartment is beautifully-located – the area is a delight to wander around in – and close to public transport; for anyone leaving from Gare du Nord, either by Eurostar (as I did) or taking the RER-B to one of the two airports, it's a cinch. The bed is also extremely comfortable, and the hot water very hot. No complaints whatsoever about this bijou little find, which offers a lovely base for your Paris visit.

reviews.name: Renée
reviews.text: Georges' apartment is very quaint and conveniently located. The Canal Saint-Martin area is a great area to use as a base for exploring the rest of Paris. I only wish I could have stayed longer!

reviews.name: Louise
reviews.text: We had a faultless stay at Georges and Jeans apartment! It was definitely our home away from home while we were in Paris! Georges was so easy to communicate with and we were able to arrange a meeting time effortlessly. He gave us an extensive description of everything the apartment had to offer and went out if his way to ensure that our stay was as comfortable as possible. The area itself is amazing! So close to a metro stop which will take you wherever you need to go and the street itself has an array of shops to satisfy any craving you have! You can really immerse yourself in the Parisian culture and we always felt safe. Georges really knows how to treat his guests and I recommend his apartment 100%! We loved it so much that we are booked in again! Thank you so much for everything Georges and Jean! We will see you soon! Louise and John

reviews.name: Valeria
reviews.text: Georges was a very kind host! We had a problem with the water and he immediately fix it! The apartment it's small but it's equipped with everything you need. It's very close to the metro and to Gare De L'Est, so it's very easy to go around in the city. Just the wifi it's quite slow. He was very nice with us and the communication with him perfect. Thank you Georges!

reviews.name: Toshiaki
reviews.text: Thanks Valeria, Effectively we had a problem with the wifi, but I called the operator to resolve this problem and now every thing is ok Georges

reviews.name: Bella
reviews.text: This was our first airbnb experience and the choices were overwhelming in Paris (!). We did alot of researches and found this charming apartment! Geoges was very friendly and helpful on our very late arrival. Place is small (but it is Paris!) and has everything you need. Very clean! Near to metro station and gare de l'est! :) highly recommended!

reviews.name: Adityagiri
reviews.text: Georges was an amazing host. Even before landing in Paris he helped us with questions we had and made us feel comfortable about our trip. It was very helpful to have Georges's advice on restaurants to eat at, sights to see , transit etc. Nothing better than a Parisian giving you genuine tourist advice while in Paris. Georges arranged for a friend to welcome us when we arrived who showed us around the apartment. Georges left us some fresh croissants one morning, it was a very pleasant surprise. The apartment is cozy, warm and has all the amenities (Nespresso machine :) ) you would need for a week long stay. The apartment is located near the Saint-martin canal, so it is perfect for a nice walk near the canal. It is close to many good restaurants ( french, Indian, Mexican, middle eastern) and bakeries. The cheese shop Georges recommended was amazing - trust the lady in the store and you will walk away with some great cheese/wine pairings. The apartment is 5 minutes from the metro station, 10-15 minutes from Gare du Nord (this is the station you take from the airport). The metro is super easy to use and gives you access to all parts of the city. Just be sure to have cash to buys tickets. There are pharmacies, ATMs, grocery stores and laundromats within a block. All in all we were charmed by both Georges's hospitality and Paris in general. At the next chance we would stay with Georges again.

reviews.name: Helen
reviews.text: Thank you Georges for a great stay, we loved the studio and the 10th district. The studio is small but perfectly formed, it has everything you need for a weekend break - including a coffee machine and a very comfortable bed. Thanks for your hospitality and the morning pastries!

reviews.name: Lara
reviews.text: I visited Paris with a friend and Georges' studio was absolutely perfect for our 5 day stay. It had all the amenities needed (kitchenette/coffee machine/small dining table etc.), was right next to the metro, situated on a cute street with multiple bakeries (for some fresh French breakfast!). We were within walking distance of most areas we wanted to visit and the Canal/Oberkampf area with some great bars and restaurants. I absolutely loved my stay in Paris and hope to return soon - If I do, I hope Georges will have us over again!

reviews.name: Rachael
reviews.text: We loved Georges little apartment, it was exactly what we needed & so close to metro stations! Finding croissants on our doorstep after our first night was just delightful!

reviews.name: Santiago
reviews.text: We are very happy for having chosen Georges´ apartment for our stay. We had a really nice time in Paris and an important factor for that was this beautiful apartment. The location is great, really close to the metro station and in a beautiful neighborhood. The apartment is really charming, cozy and tidy and has everything needed to have a comfortable stay. Georges is a very nice and warm host and gave us really good tips for our stay, such as nice restaurants nearby and in the city center. He also surprised us by leaving us some croissants and pain au chocolat for breakfast the first morning. Totally recommendable!

reviews.name: Andrei
reviews.text: Georges was a great host. The small but cozy apartment had everything it needed, from fresh towels to coffee and tea maker. Georges provided us with everything even welcome drinks. We really got value for our money. It was a lovely experience. Thank you Georges :)

reviews.name: Kirsten
reviews.text: My son and I had a very nice time in Paris and in the flat from Georges. The flat is nice and we found everything we needed. Georges is a very friendly and attentive person. My compliments!

reviews.name: Gabriele
reviews.text: We had a great time staying in Georges' apartment. The flat itself is clean and modern, and is located in a quiet off-street courtyard. It's small, but has everything you need: a comfortable fold-out double bed, kitchenette, decent wi-fi, a Nespresso machine, TV and a small but perfectly usable shower. It's about 5 minutes from the metro (Chateau Landon or Louis Blanc, both M7) which will get you into the centre in 10-15 minutes. Very highly recommended!

reviews.name: Dave
reviews.text: Georges was a charming host. The flat is small but perfectly formed, with everything you need for a short stay in Paris (including expert tips and croissants from Georges). It's very quiet, but in a bustling neighbourhood and close to Metro stations and the Canal Saint-Martin (a great place to enjoy the wine Georges also left us!). Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Ema
reviews.text: The apartment was cozy, clean, perfect for 2 people, and ideal for getting anywhere in Paris.Great bakery and cheese shop! Would stay here again.

reviews.name: Rafal
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay in the apartment, which is very well-placed with three metro lines nearby. It's easy to get anywhere and return at any time. We loved the inner court full of greenery, it made our stay all the more charming. But the thing that made the biggest impression was how Georges prepared the apartment for us. Since it was our honeymoon, on arrival we found a huge bouquet of flowers, champagne and a selection of jams (in addition to all the usual things one might or might not expect, like soap, tea etc.). Also, since Georges couldn't have been there to greet us (we got the keys from a very friendly neighbor), we found a few personal welcoming notes with greetings and information, which was a nice touch. As for the apartment itself, it didn't lack anything. Except for the obvious things, it had a selection of local guides and other books, many TV channels and superhot water. It was clean and easy to arrange for our needs. It's located in the fashionable St. Martin Canal area, full of cafes and restaurants. We usually ate further away but we enjoyed the bakery next door and the cheese shop with its extremely friendly salesperson, who took pains to communicate with us despite our imperfect French. Overall, we enjoyed our stay extremely and found Georges' apartment a wonderful base for our expeditions around the city.

reviews.name: Alexandar
reviews.text: The apartment was great, equipped with everything you need. Our host welcomed us, showed us everything and there were welcoming drinks in the fridge as well ! Also, the location is nice, and you have stores, a bakery and a post office in the same street. I would definitely recommend staying at Georges place !

reviews.name: Lilli
reviews.text: I booked Georges's appartament for my parents, I wanted to give them a confortable place to stay and enjoy the visit of Paris. We have nothing to complain, everything was perfect. obviously next time we will come back! thanks for everything!

reviews.name: Samantha
reviews.text: Loved staying at Georges charming St martin apartment. Convenient for public transport, really nicely decorated and georges really, made us feel at home by stocking the fridge with a few goodies and even bringing us an amazing croissant and pain au chocolat one morning. Apartment was really clean and felt safe and secure the whole time, would highly recommend.

reviews.name: Renata
reviews.text: Georges' apartment is well-equipped and clean. It is small but suitable for 2 people. The location is not touristy, which means you can get a different view of Paris. The street has everything you could need: supermarket, cheese shops, wine shops, bakeries, restaurants, etc, all reasonably priced. The apartment is also close to a metro station, and walking distance from Gare du Nord, which is very convenient. Georges was a great host and easy to communicate with. I would recommend this apartment if you are looking for something a little off the tourist trail, but with easy access to all that Paris has to offer!

reviews.name: Arna
reviews.text: My Mum and her partner stayed in the gorgeous apartment for three nights. They said they enjoyed their experience very much and would not hesitate to book again!

reviews.name: Amber
reviews.text: Georges was an excellent host! The flat was beautifully furnished with all the comforts of home. The espresso machine was a particularly lovely touch! The flat was located in a wonderful area an we always felt very secure. Georges left instructions for everything in the flat as well as some wonderful recommendations for local restaurants. The bakery right down the street was delicious and there was a wonderful take out place serving traditional Mexican cuisine nearby for those looking for something a bit different. Georges had someone waiting for us as soon as we arrived and was always easy to communicate with during our stay. The flat was extremely clean and comfortable, we couldn't have asked for a better experience! Will definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in Paris.

reviews.name: Jocelyn
reviews.text: Georges gave us a warm welcome in very good English. The apartment was well equipped and very peaceful. It is easy to walk to the apartment from the Gare du Nord or the Gare de l'Est; three different metro stations are within a 5-minute walk. Shops on the block sold very nice cheeses, breads, wine, and prepared foods. We found good (and not very expensive) restaurants nearby. Georges provides excellent value, as well as the opportunity to discover and up and coming part of Paris (the 10th arrondissment). Merci bien!

reviews.name: Dayane
reviews.text: We loved everything about the flat. It is safe, clean, cosy, near to metro station, markets and restaurants. Georges is really amazing, very helpful and kind, a perfect host. Our stay was unforgettable. Thank you very much!

reviews.name: Becks And Bryan
reviews.text: George was great, readily available to us and very kind:) Place is small but enough for 2, close to metro and shops! thanks george!

reviews.name: Jonathon
reviews.text: We had a great stay in Georges' studio. Fantastic, authentic Parisian studio that has been well fitted out and is close to public transport, restaurants, bars etc. It is very easy to get to all of the sights of Paris from Georges' studio by either metro or walking. Georges is a terrific host and was very accommodating. He is very friendly, helped us understand where everything was and had a bottle of wine and welcoming drinks ready for us in the studio on arrival. During our stay he even left us cheese and croissants in a bag on our door following an earlier discussion we had about French camembert - a really nice touch.

reviews.name: JeongWon
reviews.text: Georges was very very kind and nice host. every keep the furniture and machine was so clean & comfortable. And great location. i'd never forgot your kindness. thank you.

reviews.name: Cris
reviews.text: Georges were very pleasant and attentive all the time we talked before my trip and the flat is fantastic. Small (like almost all the Parisien flats) but very well furnished, clean, comfortable, cozy and super well located, next to the beautiful Canal San Martin, next to Gare du Nord and Gare de l´Est, next to some metro stations... highly recommended!!!

reviews.name: Brad
reviews.text: Georges was a gracious host! He left jams, jellies, drinks, coffee, tea and wine at check-in, had local restaurant recommendations, and was incredibly accommodating. The flat is literally a 2 minute walk from the Chateau Landon metro stop on line 7 (maybe 10-15 minutes total to central Paris), and a 10 minute walk from Gare du Nord. I felt safe; the neighborhood was quiet and the flat secure behind an entry gate (which opens up to a lovely courtyard), a building door, and the lock to the apartment. As is typical of any European apartment, don't expect tons of space. The flat is well thought-out and clean, but definitely only for 1-2 people, max.

reviews.name: Katy
reviews.text: Georges was AMAZING. So helpful and gave the best hints and tips, looked up special directions for us to get to the Catacombs, which metro to get etc. The croissants & Jams left for us in the morning were such a special touch. Absolutely perfect little studio apartment for a few nights in Paris, very stylishly decorated and secure.

reviews.name: Andreja
reviews.text: Geogres was great! The apartment is small but great for 2 persons.
